content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator e raised to the 2 x power, minus 1, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following equations expresses the property that <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> can be made arbitrarily close to 2 by taking <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sufficiently close to 0, but not equal to 0 ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of open parenthesis, the limit as x approaches 0, of, x, close parenthesis, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0, of, f of x, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
